Instruction: Saute onion, jalapeno peppers, and garlic in oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat until the onion is tender, about 5 to 7 minutes. Season with cumin and cayenne pepper. Add in corn, chicken broth, and diced chicken to the mixture.
Boil the mixture, reduce heat, cover, and simmer until the chicken is thoroughly cooked, approximately 15 minutes. Remove from heat and allow the soup to cool.
Blend soup in small batches until smooth using a blender, cover blender with a towel to avoid splatters.(Optional: Run the blended soup through a sieve for a smoother consistency)
